items.title: Vim
items.description: Vim is the go-to command line text editor on Linux with a rich feature set.

items.title: Eclipse
items.description:
Eclipse is an open source (predominanty) Java environment. Android development was tied to Eclipse, untill Google launched Google Studio.

https://eclipse.org/

items.title: Xcode
items.description:
Xcode by Apple is mandatory for iOS development.

https://developer.apple.com/xcode/

items.title: Emacs
items.description:
Developed in the 80', Emacs is still the go-to code editor for a large group of developers. It has extensive ways to personalise the editor.

https://www.gnu.org/software/emacs/

items.title: Sublime
items.description:
Sublime is a favorite for developers due to speed and stability, but also a large repository of plugins.

https://www.sublimetext.com/

items.title: Visual Studio Code
items.description: Visual Studio Code by Microsoft is free with support for macOS, linux and (of course) windows and a wide variety of [languages](https://code.visualstudio.com/?wt.mc_id=DX_841432). IntelliSense (function autocomplete) is one of its key features.

items.title: Atom
items.description:
Atom by Github is powered by Javascript and quickly gained traction for its ease of use, and wide plugin support.

https://atom.io/
